statement:
Let $\mu$ and $\nu$ be two $\sigma$-finite signed measures in the
measurable space $(\Omega,\mathscr{S})$. There exist two signed measures
$\nu_0$ and $\nu_1$ such that:

1.  $\nu=\nu_0+\nu_1$;

2.  $\nu_0\ll\mu$ (i.e. $\nu_0$ is absolutely continuous with respect to
    $\mu$;)

3.  $\nu_1\perp\mu$ (i.e. $\nu_1$ and $\mu$ are singular.)

These two measures are uniquely determined.
